parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Inventory

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Check how many rounds are left in the currently loaded magazine in the given muzzle. Since Arma v1.55.133505 the command also returns ammo for units in vehicles.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unit '''ammo''' muzzle

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> muzzle: [[String]] - muzzle of a weapon. See the topic [[:Category:Weapons]] for reference about possible values.

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_count = [[player]] [[ammo]] "M16"; //returns 30 in case of a full magazine</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_count = [[player]] [[ammo]] "M203Muzzle";</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_count = [[player]] [[ammo]] [[primaryWeapon]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setAmmo]], [[someAmmo]], [[magazines]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on February 17, 2012</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:kju|kju]]</dt>
<dd class="note">'''OA 1.60''': The command works (now?) also for units in vehicles. However only for the vehicle's gunners' weapons - aka those returned by "weapons vehicle".

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>



[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.99|AMMO]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.96|AMMO]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.46|AMMO]]
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma1</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma2</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>tkoh</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 30, 2018 - 15:42 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:.kju|.kju]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Actually the command wants the [[currentMuzzle]] ([[gunner]] _vehicle) as parameter - not the weapon class.
Most of the time both are the same. However when you have custom [[CfgWeapons_Config_Reference#modes.5B.5D.3D_.7B.22this.22.7D|modes[]]] for the weapons, this is likely not true.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
